hedline.hl1: By Buckingham Palace, A Place for Pampering

abstract.p: 41, new 20-room, club-style hotel opens near London's Buckingham Palace; rooms from $520 a night and suites from $925 a night include wide range of amenities such as staff butlers and 24-hour buffets (S)

block.p: The place for royal treatment in London is Buckingham Palace, of course. Wrong lineage? Well, 41, a new hotel just down the street at 41 Buckingham Palace Road, may be the next best option.

This 20-room club-style hotel on the top floor of a five-story Victorian building across from the Royal Mews has been designed as a home-office away from home for movers and shakers. The room rate covers the services of the two staff butlers who are always on duty and a 24-hour buffet of salads, sandwiches, pasta, pizzas and drinks in a mahogany and leather lounge.

This 20-room club-style hotel on the top floor of a five-story Victorian building across from the Royal Mews has been designed as a home-office away from home for movers and shakers. The room rate covers the services of the two staff butlers who are always on duty and a 24-hour buffet of salads, sandwiches, pasta, pizzas and drinks in a mahogany and leather lounge.

The 16 rooms and 4 split-level suites are decorated in power-broker black and white, including the marble and tile baths. Most rooms have working fireplaces, and each has a fully stocked minibar (no extra charge); high-speed Internet access with wireless keyboard and mouse; a fax-scanner-printer, and DVD and CD players. There is also a business center.
The rates at 41, at $1.50 to the pound, are $520 a night, and $705 and $925 for suites, and include a full breakfast, afternoon tea, and laundry and dry-cleaning services.
Reservations: (800) 552-6844; the phone number for 41 is (44-20) 7300-0041, the fax (44-20) 7300-0141. The Web address is www .redcarnationhotels.com.
